title: Sheffield Forest Walks

images.title: Nigel Freeman / Sheffield Forest
images.caption: Sheffield Forest. Thanks to the Forestry Commission you can enjoy this large woodland with some shy Fallow Deer.

images.title: Nigel Freeman / Sheffield Forest
images.caption: A track in the mainly coniferous wood.

images.title: Nigel Freeman / Annwood Brook pond
images.caption: Annwood Brook pond. A number of man made ponds in this area. Some used for fishing others just for beauty. This one is possibly for both ! And makes a good home for swans.

images.title: Nigel Freeman / Tanyard Fisheries
images.caption: Tanyard Fisheries. A series of 7 man made coarse fishing lakes on the western side of the woods.

images.title: Bluebells, Sheffield Forest by N Chadwick, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bluebells in May

images.title: Southern boundary of Sheffield Forest by Dave Spicer, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Southern boundary of the forest

description: This circular walk explores a peaceful area of woodland near Nutley and Horsted Keynes in the High Weald. There's a network of nice trails to follow around the site with lots of wildlife to see on the way. Keep your eyes peeled for Crossbill, Nightjar, Hobbies and Buzzards as you make your way around the site. You can start off from the parking area on Bell Lane on the eastern side of the woods at postcode TN22 3YB. At the western side of the woods there's also a series of ponds around Furner's Green. The walk can be extend by heading a short distance south to visit the National Trust's Sheffield Park . There's some splendid 'Capability' Brown landscaped gardens with four delightful lakes to see in the expansive park.
